so ever since we bought this car this
toyota corolla 1990
30 year old car we've had lots of people

and commenting saying their opinions
about

so what happened the other day was this
mechanical fuel pump actually stopped
working
the funny thing is the mechanic said it
was actually a new one that was in there
already but they're notorious for
breaking down these things
and the reason for that is it's not a
genuine toyota parts so these are the
things we're finding out about living
here on charge out island
we are cut off from the rest of the
philippines in many ways it takes a lot
longer for stuff to get here
and it's harder for us to get genuine
parts i have owned
old cars my whole life cars much older
than this and i know for a fact that if
you maintain them well and you get the
right parts and you find a good mechanic
eventually they will run perfectly for a
long time
we are at the very beginning of our
relationship with this car and this is

to rest assured that this car is not
that bad

from what's available here on this

and in the best condition considering

in dapper said that because these

they've also fitted a low pressure

this is something

this would cost me
50 pounds per hour to have labor done

what i found amusing is they have a

so it says we can do good quick and

all three
good and quick work won't be cheap good
and cheap work won't be quick
and cheap quick work won't be good now i
absolutely love this because
in the west you would never write
something like this on your
company policy paperwork
and yet here there is an understanding
that if you want it done a certain way
you can still have it done that way
but there will be consequences and i
like that it's honesty
and i think that that is all part of
living the filipino way
it's up to you you've got a choice you
can bodge things up if you want but then
you can't expect it to be amazing or you
can spend the money and spend the time

a nice level of transparency there and i
